newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil council approves Q3 monetary plan.
newsitem.headline: Brazil council approves Q3 monetary plan.

text.p: Brazil's National Monetary Council (CMN) Thursday approved a monetary plan for the third quarter of 1997 that sees M1, the narrowest definition of money supply, expanding to between 33.8-39.7 billion reais.
In a statement, the Central Bank said the CMN had set its third quarter target for M4, the widest definition of money supply, at between 340.4-399.6 billion reais.
The bank said money supply growth in the second quarter of the year was kept within projections.

M1 ended June at 36.8 billion reais compared with a target range of 35.1-41.2 billion reais, while M4 was at 351.8 billion reais at the end of June compared with a projection of 337.5-396.2 billion reais.
For the year, the M1 target was set at 41.0-50.1 billion reais and the M4 target at 346.8-423.8 billion reais.
